author: AAP
title: We need sensible savings for tax cuts: PM
summary: TONY Abbott says his government is always looking for sensible savings so it can cut taxes after his treasurer argued for personal income tax cuts.

author: AAP
title: NZ shares join global selloff
summary: THE S&P/NZX 50 Index has fallen almost two per cent heading for its biggest daily decline since October 2011.

author: Katina Curtis
title: Unions to tell MPs of China trade worries
summary: A PARLIAMENTARY committee examining Australia's trade deal with China will hear union concerns about the agreement.

author: Nicholas Riccardi
title: Working class squeezed out of resort towns
summary: THE rich are moving in and the working class are being squeezed out in chic US resort towns highlighting how the rich are getting rich but no one else is.

author: AAP
title: Hockey confident about global outlook
summary: TREASURER Joe Hockey is upbeat about the global economic outlook despite the uncertainty that's triggering falls on world markets.

author: AAP
title: Vic girls given experimental contraceptive
summary: THE child abuse royal commission has heard girls at a Victorian state-run youth centre were given a contraceptive injection that was experimental.

author: By Annette Blackwell
title: Bishop to recall row with papal nuncio
summary: GEOFFREY Robinson the outspoken Catholic bishop has told a royal commission that the Church struggled to deal with abuse by clergy.

author: By Andrew Drummond
title: Baby suffered crushing head injury
summary: AN inquest into the death of a newborn baby has been told that by three weeks old he had suffered non-accidental fractures to his skull ribs and pelvis.

author: AAP
title: Twitter liberates adults with no speech
summary: TWITTER levels the playing field for adults with no speech including those who have had a stroke or motor neurone disease say researchers.

author: AAP
title: Adelaide council removes potential weapons
summary: ADELAIDE City Council will remove 'potential weapons' from its rooms ahead of a meeting finalising an LGBT rainbow walk and booze bans in parks.
